Package helper

Class commonMethods

java.lang.Object
helper.commonMethods
public class commonMethods
extends java.lang.Object
Contains methods required across several classes.
Author:
Sudesh Agrawal (sudesh@utexas.edu). Last Updated: September 23, 2020.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    commonMethods()

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static double calculateDelta​(graph g, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> simulationResults, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> honeypots, int honeypotsFrequency)
    Calculates the sum of the marginal function values for the top k nodes that fail to be in the solution.
    static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> elementwiseMultiplyMatrix​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> a, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> b)
    Element-wise multiplication of two list of lists.
    static int findMaxRowFrequencyNode​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes)
    Finds a node in nodes which is present in the most rows of arr.
    static int findMaxRowFrequencyNodeOld​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes)
    Deprecated.
    static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> findRowOccurrenceIndices​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, int node)
    Finds indices of rows where node occurs in arr.
    static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getContingencyTable​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes1, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes2)
    Finds n11, n12, n21, and n22: n11 number of rows in arr where a node from both nodes1 and nodes2 are present n12 number of rows in arr where a node * from nodes1 is present, but no nodes from nodes2 are present n21 number of rows in arr where no nodes * from nodes1 are present, but a node from nodes2 is present n22 number of rows in arr where no nodes * from either nodes1 or nodes2 are present.
    static java.util.PriorityQueue<java.lang.Integer> getKHighestDegreeNodes​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> degreesOfNodes, int k)
    Returns the k highest degree nodes.

  • Method Details

    • elementwiseMultiplyMatrix

      public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> elementwiseMultiplyMatrix​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> a, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> b) throws java.lang.Exception
      Element-wise multiplication of two list of lists. Only integer lists allowed.
      Parameters:
      a - the first list of lists
      b - the second list of lists.
      Returns:
      a list of lists.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - thrown if outer lists a and b not of same size. Corresponding inner lists should also be of same size, but that exception is not thrown since the check would be expensive.

    • findMaxRowFrequencyNode

      public static int findMaxRowFrequencyNode​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes)
      Finds a node in nodes which is present in the most rows of arr.
      Parameters:
      arr - a list of lists
      nodes - a list of integers (nodes).
      Returns:
      a node as int.

    • findMaxRowFrequencyNodeOld

      @Deprecated public static int findMaxRowFrequencyNodeOld​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes)
      Deprecated.
      Slower and older version of findMaxRowFrequencyNode.
      Parameters:
      arr - a list of lists
      nodes - a list of integers (nodes).
      Returns:
      a node as int.

    • findRowOccurrenceIndices

      public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> findRowOccurrenceIndices​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, int node)
      Finds indices of rows where node occurs in arr.
      Parameters:
      arr - a list of lists
      node - a list of integers (nodes).
      Returns:
      a list of indices.

    • calculateDelta

      public static double calculateDelta​(graph g, java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> simulationResults, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> honeypots, int honeypotsFrequency)
      Calculates the sum of the marginal function values for the top k nodes that fail to be in the solution. Let us call it the delta value. Refer section 2.4.1 in Lee, Jinho. Stochastic optimization models for rapid detection of viruses in cellphone networks. Diss. 2012.
      Parameters:
      g - network graph
      simulationResults - sample paths of a simulation
      honeypots - list of nodes in the solution
      honeypotsFrequency - number of sample paths covered by the honeypots in the solution.
      Returns:
      the delta value.

    • getKHighestDegreeNodes

      public static java.util.PriorityQueue<java.lang.Integer> getKHighestDegreeNodes​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer> degreesOfNodes, int k)
      Returns the k highest degree nodes.
      Parameters:
      degreesOfNodes - map from node to its degree in the graph
      k - number of top degree nodes required.
      Returns:
      the k highest degree nodes.

    • getContingencyTable

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getContingencyTable​(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> arr, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes1, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodes2)
      Finds n11, n12, n21, and n22:
      n11
      number of rows in arr where a node from both nodes1 and nodes2 are present
      n12
      number of rows in arr where a node * from nodes1 is present, but no nodes from nodes2 are present
      n21
      number of rows in arr where no nodes * from nodes1 are present, but a node from nodes2 is present
      n22
      number of rows in arr where no nodes * from either nodes1 or nodes2 are present.
      Parameters:
      arr - a list of lists of integers.
      nodes1 - a list of integers.
      nodes2 - a list of integers.
      Returns:
      a map from {n11, n12, n21, and n22} to corresponding value.
